required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Low Level Laser Therapy (808nm) on Muscle Performance of Young Women Submitted to Physical Training
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Low Level Laser Therapy (808nm) on Muscle Performance of Young Women Submitted to Physical Training

collaborator.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico

brief_summary.textblock: The study hypothesis is an increase in muscle performance and a higher aerobic adaptation of young women submitted to chronic endurance training program associated to low level laser therapy when compared to chronic aerobic training alone.

detailed_description.textblock: The study assessed women muscle performance in isokinetic dynamometry, ventilatory parameters such as ventilatory threshold, VO2Peak, VO2Max, Ventilation. Maximal load in cycle ergometer test (Balke's protocol), Borg Scale and Heart rate were assessed too.

primary_outcome.measure: Fatigue Index of knee extensor muscles
primary_outcome.description: Fatigue Index of knee extensor muscles assessed in isokinetic dynamometry.
Ventilatory threshold quantified by a gas analyzer.
VO2max quantified by a gas analyzer.
VO2peak quantified by a gas analyzer.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum load of effort on cycle ergometer (Balke's protocol).
primary_outcome.description: Maximum load of effort on cycle ergometer quantified in Watts.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total work of knee extensor muscles
secondary_outcome.description: Total work of knee extensor muscles assessed in isokinetic dynamometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak torque of knee extensor muscles
secondary_outcome.description: Peak torque of knee extensor muscles assessed in isokinetic dynamometry
Subjective effort perception assessed by Borg scale
Heart Rate assessed by cardiac frequency meter

arm_group.description: Effects of low level laser therapy on aerobic capacity of young women submitted to endurance training

intervention.intervention_name: Phototherapy by low level laser therapy
intervention.description: Phototherapy by low level laser therapy during 9 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy young women volunteers
- women with a beginner or moderately trained pattern of physical activity
- body Mass Index (BMI) between 18 and 25kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous injury to the femoral quadriceps or hamstrings muscles (within 6 months prior to study)
- osseous or articular disorder in the lower limbs
- cardiovascular system disorders or systemic disease
